required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Lyrica (Pregabalin) Administered as an Add-on Therapy for Partial Seizures (LEADER).
clinical_study.official_title: Lyrica (Pregabalin) Administered As An Add-On Therapy For Partial Seizures (LEADER) An Open-Label, Multicenter Add-On Therapy Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of study is to assess the clinical improvement (change in seizure frequency), safety, and tolerability of subjects with partial seizures following adjunctive therapy of pregabalin BID (150 to 600 mg/day titration) in addition to existing standards AEDs.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage Change in Partial Seizure Frequency (All Partial Seizure Types) Between Baseline and the 12 Week Observation Period
primary_outcome.time_frame: 8 week baseline period & 12 week treatment observation period

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage Change in Partial Seizure Frequency (All Partial Seizure Types) Between Baseline and the Whole 21 Week Open-label Treatment Period.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 8 week baseline period and 21 week treatment period

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage Change in Partial Seizure Frequency (All Partial Seizure Types) Between the 8 Week Baseline Period and 4 Week Intervals During the 21 Week Open-label Treatment Period.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 8 week baseline period and 21 week treatment period
last 4 weeks & whole 12 week treatment observation period

secondary_outcome.measure: Reduction in Partial Seizure Frequency Between Baseline and the Final 4 Weeks of the Observation Period.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 8 week baseline observation period & last 4 weeks of observation period

secondary_outcome.measure: Subjects Achieving Seizure Freedom During Observation Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 147 from the first dose of study drug

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Partial Seizure Frequency (All Partial Seizure Types) Between Baseline and the 12 Week Observation Period Categorized by Baseline Seizure Frequency
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 8 week baseline observation period & 12 week treatment observation period

secondary_outcome.measure: Impression of Change in Overall Status Using the Patient Global Impression of Change (PGIC)
Subjects With Categorical Impression of Change in Overall Status Using the Clinical Global Impression of Change (CGIC)
Changes From Baseline in Medical Outcomes Study (MOS) Sleep Scale Scores
Change From Baseline in Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale(HADS) Depression and Anxiety Symptoms Subscales Between Baseline and Week 21.
Number of Subjects With a Weight Gain at End of Treatment of at Least 7% Relative to Baseline

intervention.description: Pregabalin treatment, given as 2 divided doses, is initiated at a dose of 150 mg/day (75 mg BID). Based on individual subject response and tolerability, the dosage may be increased to 300 mg/day after 1 week (150 mg BID given as two 75-mg capsules BID). Based on subjects individual response and tolerability, dosage can be incrementally increased further after an additional week to 600 mg/day (300 mg BID given as four 75-mg capsules BID).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Outpatients equal to or greater than 18 years of age with diagnosis of epilepsy with partial seizures having minimum of two partial seizures during a two month period before the baseline visit
- Having a clinical history of epilepsy and AED treatment at least 1 year prior to inclusion
Exclusion Criteria:
- AED or Seizures/Epilepsy Related Exclusions:having a treatable cause of seizures
- Having absences seizures
- Having had status epileptics within the year prior to inclusion
- Having a progressive neurological or systematic disorder
- Having known significant renal or hepatic dysfunction

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Planned to enroll approximately 100 subjects with partial seizures at up to 10 study centers in Greece.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Single arm open label study without randomization. The study included the following 3 main phases with a total study treatment duration of up to 21 weeks: Treatment dose-optimization phase = 9 weeks. Treatment observation phase = 12 weeks.

group.title: Pregabalin
group.description: Pregabalin treatment, given as 2 divided doses, was initiated at a dose of 150 mg/day (75 mg BID). Then, based on individual subject response and tolerability, the dosage could have been increased to 300 mg/day after 1 week. The dosage could have been incrementally increased further to 600 mg/day after an additional week. After 9 weeks of treatment, the optimal dose of pregabalin was to be maintained for 3 months (12 week treatment observation period).

group.title: Pregabalin
group.description: Pregabalin treatment, given as 2 divided doses, was initiated at a dose of 150 mg/day (75 mg BID). Then, based on individual subject response and tolerability, the dosage could have been increased to 300 mg/day after 1 week. The dosage could have been incrementally increased further to 600 mg/day after an additional week. After 9 weeks of treatment, the optimal dose of pregabalin was to be maintained for 3 months (12 week treatment observation period).

outcome.title: Percentage Change in Partial Seizure Frequency (All Partial Seizure Types) Between Baseline and the 12 Week Observation Period
outcome.description: Percentage change from baseline=[(12 week treatment observation period seizure frequency rate minus 8 week baseline period seizure frequency rate)/ 8 week baseline period seizure frequency rate] x 100. Seizure frequencies per 28-day period: = (total # of partial seizures in period x 28 / (total # of days in period).
outcome.time_frame: 8 week baseline period & 12 week treatment observation period
outcome.population: Full analysis set (FAS)/intent-to-treat (ITT) population (all subjects who received at least 1 dose of study treatment & had a minimum of 2 partial seizures during baseline period). Seizure rate was calculated on last observation carried forward (LOCF) basis, whereby data from last 84 days prior to last dose was used to calculate seizure frequency.

group.title: Pregabalin
group.description: Pregabalin treatment, given as 2 divided doses, was initiated at a dose of 150 mg/day (75 mg BID). Then, based on individual subject response and tolerability, the dosage could have been increased to 300 mg/day after 1 week. The dosage could have been incrementally increased further to 600 mg/day after an additional week. After 9 weeks of treatment, the optimal dose of pregabalin was to be maintained for 3 months (12 week treatment observation period).

measure.title: Percentage Change in Partial Seizure Frequency (All Partial Seizure Types) Between Baseline and the 12 Week Observation Period
measure.description: Percentage change from baseline=[(12 week treatment observation period seizure frequency rate minus 8 week baseline period seizure frequency rate)/ 8 week baseline period seizure frequency rate] x 100. Seizure frequencies per 28-day period: = (total # of partial seizures in period x 28 / (total # of days in period).
measure.population: Full analysis set (FAS)/intent-to-treat (ITT) population (all subjects who received at least 1 dose of study treatment & had a minimum of 2 partial seizures during baseline period). Seizure rate was calculated on last observation carried forward (LOCF) basis, whereby data from last 84 days prior to last dose was used to calculate seizure frequency.

analysis.groups_desc: Noncomparative study. Summary stats, 2 sided 95% CI to est. effect size. No adjustments made to alpha levels to acct for multiple 2o endpts. Sample size=83 patients (pts) sufficient to detect statistically significant difference in % change from baseline in 28-day seizure rate with 80% power, true change from baseline approximately 25%. Allowing for dropouts assume 85% pts analyzed.
analysis.estimate_desc: Response ratio = 100 x [(t – b)/(t + b)] where t=treatment seizure frequency and b=baseline seizure frequency.

outcome.title: Percentage Change in Partial Seizure Frequency (All Partial Seizure Types) Between Baseline and the Whole 21 Week Open-label Treatment Period.
outcome.description: Percentage change from baseline = ((21 weeks-8 weeks)/8 weeks)*100. Negative mean R-Ratios and associated 95% CIs that do not include zero indicate reduction in partial seizure frequency.
outcome.time_frame: 8 week baseline period and 21 week treatment period
outcome.population: Full analysis set (FAS)/intent-to-treat (ITT) population (all subjects who received at least 1 dose of study treatment & had a minimum of 2 partial seizures during baseline period). Seizure rate was calculated on last observation carried forward (LOCF) basis, whereby data from last 84 days prior to last dose was used to calculate seizure frequency.

Then, based on individual subject response and tolerability, the dosage could have been increased to 300 mg/day after 1 week. The dosage could have been incrementally increased further to 600 mg/day after an additional week. After 9 weeks of treatment, the optimal dose of pregabalin was to be maintained for 3 months (12 week treatment observation period).

measure.title: Percentage Change in Partial Seizure Frequency (All Partial Seizure Types) Between Baseline and the Whole 21 Week Open-label Treatment Period.
measure.description: Percentage change from baseline = ((21 weeks-8 weeks)/8 weeks)*100. Negative mean R-Ratios and associated 95% CIs that do not include zero indicate reduction in partial seizure frequency.
measure.population: Full analysis set (FAS)/intent-to-treat (ITT) population (all subjects who received at least 1 dose of study treatment & had a minimum of 2 partial seizures during baseline period). Seizure rate was calculated on last observation carried forward (LOCF) basis, whereby data from last 84 days prior to last dose was used to calculate seizure frequency.

analysis.groups_desc: Noncomparative study. Summary stats, 2 sided 95% CI to est. effect size. No adjustments made to alpha levels to acct for multiple 2o endpts. Sample size=83 patients (pts) sufficient to detect statistically significant difference in % change from baseline in 28-day seizure rate with 80% power, true change from baseline approximately 25%. Allowing for dropouts assume 85% pts analyzed.
analysis.estimate_desc: Response ratio = 100 x [(t – b)/(t + b)] where t=treatment seizure frequency and b=baseline seizure frequency.

outcome.title: Percentage Change in Partial Seizure Frequency (All Partial Seizure Types) Between the 8 Week Baseline Period and 4 Week Intervals During the 21 Week Open-label Treatment Period.
outcome.description: Percentage change from baseline = [(4 week seizure frequency minus 8 week baseline) / (8 week baseline seizure frequency)] x 100. Negative mean R-Ratios and associated 95% CIs that do not include zero indicate reduction in partial seizure frequency.
outcome.time_frame: 8 week baseline period and 21 week treatment period
outcome.population: Full analysis set (FAS)/intent-to-treat (ITT) population (all subjects who received at least 1 dose of study treatment & had a minimum of 2 partial seizures during baseline period). Seizure date from patients who discontinued during any of these 4 week intervals will not be included in the summary for that interval.

outcome.description: Change from baseline = 12 week treatment observation period seizure frequency rate minus 8 week baseline period seizure frequency rate.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects Seizure-free
outcome.description: Count of subjects seizure free during the period.
outcome.time_frame: last 4 weeks & whole 12 week treatment observation period
outcome.population: Full analysis set(FAS)/intent-to-treat(ITT) all subjects who received >= 1 dose of study Tx & >= 2 partial seizures during baseline pd. LOCF if subjects withdrew then last 4 wks prior to last dose (but after visit 3). 12 wk subjects who withdrew were regarded as missing. n= # subjects evaluable for seizure freedom during defined observation pd.

group.title: Pregabalin
group.description: Pregabalin treatment, given as 2 divided doses, was initiated at a dose of 150 mg/day (75 mg BID). Then, based on individual subject response and tolerability, the dosage could have been increased to 300 mg/day after 1 week. The dosage could have been incrementally increased further to 600 mg/day after an additional week. After 9 weeks of treatment, the optimal dose of pregabalin was to be maintained for 3 months (12 week treatment observation period).

measure.description: Count of subjects seizure free during the period.
measure.population: Full analysis set(FAS)/intent-to-treat(ITT) all subjects who received >= 1 dose of study Tx & >= 2 partial seizures during baseline pd. LOCF if subjects withdrew then last 4 wks prior to last dose (but after visit 3). 12 wk subjects who withdrew were regarded as missing. n= # subjects evaluable for seizure freedom during defined observation pd.

class.title: During the last 4 weeks of Obs. period (n=86)

outcome.title: Reduction in Partial Seizure Frequency Between Baseline and the Final 4 Weeks of the Observation Period.
outcome.description: Number of subjects with at least a 50% or 75% reduction in partial seizure frequency between baseline and treatment period.
outcome.time_frame: 8 week baseline observation period & last 4 weeks of observation period
outcome.population: Full analysis set (FAS)/intent-to-treat (ITT) population (all subjects who received at least 1 dose of study treatment & had a minimum of 2 partial seizures during baseline period). Patients who discontinued less than 4 weeks into the observation period (after Visit 3/week 9) will be regarded as missing. No data prior to week 9 will be used.

group.title: Pregabalin
group.description: Pregabalin treatment, given as 2 divided doses, was initiated at a dose of 150 mg/day (75 mg BID). Then, based on individual subject response and tolerability, the dosage could have been increased to 300 mg/day after 1 week. The dosage could have been incrementally increased further to 600 mg/day after an additional week. After 9 weeks of treatment, the optimal dose of pregabalin was to be maintained for 3 months (12 week treatment observation period).

measure.title: Reduction in Partial Seizure Frequency Between Baseline and the Final 4 Weeks of the Observation Period.
measure.description: Number of subjects with at least a 50% or 75% reduction in partial seizure frequency between baseline and treatment period.
measure.population: Full analysis set (FAS)/intent-to-treat (ITT) population (all subjects who received at least 1 dose of study treatment & had a minimum of 2 partial seizures during baseline period). Patients who discontinued less than 4 weeks into the observation period (after Visit 3/week 9) will be regarded as missing. No data prior to week 9 will be used.

outcome.title: Subjects Achieving Seizure Freedom During Observation Period
outcome.description: Number of subjects achieving seizure freedom (no seizures) during last 4 weeks or duration of 12 week observation period.
outcome.time_frame: Day 147 from the first dose of study drug
outcome.population: Full analysis set (FAS)/intent-to-treat (ITT) population (all subjects who received at least 1 dose of study treatment & had a minimum of 2 partial seizures during baseline period).

outcome.title: Impression of Change in Overall Status Using the Patient Global Impression of Change (PGIC)
outcome.description: The PGIC is a patient-rated instrument that measures change in patient’s overall status on a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (very much improved) to 7 (very much worse).
outcome.population: Full analysis set (FAS)/intent-to-treat (ITT) population (all subjects who received at least 1 dose of study treatment and had a minimum of 2 partial seizures during the baseline period).

group.title: Pregabalin
group.description: Pregabalin treatment, given as 2 divided doses, was initiated at a dose of 150 mg/day (75 mg BID). Then, based on individual subject response and tolerability, the dosage could have been increased to 300 mg/day after 1 week. The dosage could have been incrementally increased further to 600 mg/day after an additional week. After 9 weeks of treatment, the optimal dose of pregabalin was to be maintained for 3 months (12 week treatment observation period).

measure.title: Impression of Change in Overall Status Using the Patient Global Impression of Change (PGIC)
measure.description: The PGIC is a patient-rated instrument that measures change in patient’s overall status on a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (very much improved) to 7 (very much worse).
measure.population: Full analysis set (FAS)/intent-to-treat (ITT) population (all subjects who received at least 1 dose of study treatment and had a minimum of 2 partial seizures during the baseline period).

outcome.title: Subjects With Categorical Impression of Change in Overall Status Using the Clinical Global Impression of Change (CGIC)
outcome.description: The CGIC is a clinician’s judgment of the overall change in the patient’s condition over a defined period on a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (very much improved) to 7 (very much worse).
outcome.population: Full analysis set (FAS)/intent-to-treat (ITT) population (all subjects who received at least 1 dose of study treatment and had a minimum of 2 partial seizures during the baseline period).

group.title: Pregabalin
group.description: Pregabalin treatment, given as 2 divided doses, was initiated at a dose of 150 mg/day (75 mg BID). Then, based on individual subject response and tolerability, the dosage could have been increased to 300 mg/day after 1 week. The dosage could have been incrementally increased further to 600 mg/day after an additional week. After 9 weeks of treatment, the optimal dose of pregabalin was to be maintained for 3 months (12 week treatment observation period).

measure.title: Subjects With Categorical Impression of Change in Overall Status Using the Clinical Global Impression of Change (CGIC)
measure.description: The CGIC is a clinician’s judgment of the overall change in the patient’s condition over a defined period on a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (very much improved) to 7 (very much worse).
measure.population: Full analysis set (FAS)/intent-to-treat (ITT) population (all subjects who received at least 1 dose of study treatment and had a minimum of 2 partial seizures during the baseline period).

outcome.title: Changes From Baseline in Medical Outcomes Study (MOS) Sleep Scale Scores
outcome.description: Subjects recall sleep related activities over the previous 4 weeks. Low scores reflect greater impairment (except sleep adequacy, optimal sleep, &quantity). Range = 0 - 100 for Sleep Disturbance, Snoring, Awaken Short of Breath, Sleep Adequacy, Somnolence, & Sleep Problems Index. Quantity of Sleep Range = 0 - 24. Optimal Sleep Range 0 – 1.
outcome.population: Full analysis set (FAS)/intent-to-treat (ITT) population (all subjects who received at least 1 dose of study treatment & had a minimum of 2 partial seizures during baseline period). "n" is the number of subjects contributing to the mean at the specified time point.

group.title: Pregabalin
group.description: Pregabalin treatment, given as 2 divided doses, was initiated at a dose of 150 mg/day (75 mg BID). Then, based on individual subject response and tolerability, the dosage could have been increased to 300 mg/day after 1 week. The dosage could have been incrementally increased further to 600 mg/day after an additional week. After 9 weeks of treatment, the optimal dose of pregabalin was to be maintained for 3 months (12 week treatment observation period).

measure.title: Changes From Baseline in Medical Outcomes Study (MOS) Sleep Scale Scores
measure.description: Subjects recall sleep related activities over the previous 4 weeks. Low scores reflect greater impairment (except sleep adequacy, optimal sleep, &quantity). Range = 0 - 100 for Sleep Disturbance, Snoring, Awaken Short of Breath, Sleep Adequacy, Somnolence, & Sleep Problems Index. Quantity of Sleep Range = 0 - 24. Optimal Sleep Range 0 – 1.
measure.population: Full analysis set (FAS)/intent-to-treat (ITT) population (all subjects who received at least 1 dose of study treatment & had a minimum of 2 partial seizures during baseline period). "n" is the number of subjects contributing to the mean at the specified time point.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale(HADS) Depression and Anxiety Symptoms Subscales Between Baseline and Week 21.
outcome.description: Change in total HADS score between Baseline and Week 21. Each of the 14 items is scored 0, 1, 2 or 3 where a score of 3 corresponds to the most anxious/depressed. 7-item depression and 7-item anxiety subscales are summed; each resulting in a total score of 0-21.
outcome.population: Full analysis set (FAS)/intent-to-treat (ITT) population (all subjects who received at least 1 dose of study treatment & had a minimum of 2 partial seizures during baseline period). "n" is the number of subjects contributing to the mean at the specified time point.

group.title: Pregabalin
group.description: Pregabalin treatment, given as 2 divided doses, was initiated at a dose of 150 mg/day (75 mg BID). Then, based on individual subject response and tolerability, the dosage could have been increased to 300 mg/day after 1 week. The dosage could have been incrementally increased further to 600 mg/day after an additional week. After 9 weeks of treatment, the optimal dose of pregabalin was to be maintained for 3 months (12 week treatment observation period).

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale(HADS) Depression and Anxiety Symptoms Subscales Between Baseline and Week 21.
measure.description: Change in total HADS score between Baseline and Week 21. Each of the 14 items is scored 0, 1, 2 or 3 where a score of 3 corresponds to the most anxious/depressed. 7-item depression and 7-item anxiety subscales are summed; each resulting in a total score of 0-21.
measure.population: Full analysis set (FAS)/intent-to-treat (ITT) population (all subjects who received at least 1 dose of study treatment & had a minimum of 2 partial seizures during baseline period). "n" is the number of subjects contributing to the mean at the specified time point.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With a Weight Gain at End of Treatment of at Least 7% Relative to Baseline
outcome.description: Count of subjects with a weight gain of at least 7 percent relative to baseline.
outcome.population: Safety population (all subjects who had taken at least 1 dose of study drug).

group.title: Pregabalin
group.description: Pregabalin treatment, given as 2 divided doses, was initiated at a dose of 150 mg/day (75 mg BID). Then, based on individual subject response and tolerability, the dosage could have been increased to 300 mg/day after 1 week. The dosage could have been incrementally increased further to 600 mg/day after an additional week. After 9 weeks of treatment, the optimal dose of pregabalin was to be maintained for 3 months (12 week treatment observation period).

measure.title: Number of Subjects With a Weight Gain at End of Treatment of at Least 7% Relative to Baseline
measure.description: Count of subjects with a weight gain of at least 7 percent relative to baseline.
measure.population: Safety population (all subjects who had taken at least 1 dose of study drug).

outcome.title: Subjects Assessment of Optimal Sleep
outcome.description: Number of subjects that responded optimal or non-optimal sleep in Optimal Sleep subscale of Medical Outcomes Study (MOS) Sleep scale.
outcome.population: Full analysis set (FAS)/intent-to-treat (ITT) population (all subjects who received at least 1 dose of study treatment & had a minimum of 2 partial seizures during baseline period).

Then, based on individual subject response and tolerability, the dosage could have been increased to 300 mg/day after 1 week. The dosage could have been incrementally increased further to 600 mg/day after an additional week. After 9 weeks of treatment, the optimal dose of pregabalin was to be maintained for 3 months (12 week treatment observation period).

measure.population: Full analysis set (FAS)/intent-to-treat (ITT) population (all subjects who received at least 1 dose of study treatment & had a minimum of 2 partial seizures during baseline period).

After 9 weeks of treatment, the optimal dose of pregabalin was to be maintained for 3 months (12 week treatment observation period).

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of <60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), <12 mo from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential info other than study results.
